DataElement.preferredName: Specimen Received By Institution Identifier Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The name of the site/institution that received a shipment of specimens.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the name or identifier for an organization responsible for the specimen submission, a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes and sent for the judgment of others._Indicates the person or authoritative body who has received something.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:Indicates the person or authoritative body who has received something.:The buildings and organizations where healthcare services are provided.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.
Indicates the person or authoritative body who has received something.
The buildings and organizations where healthcare services are provided.

Property.preferredDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the name of the organization entering patients on a clinical trial.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: groups, institutions, or clinical facilities that conduct clinical research or tests, or analyze clinical data.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The buildings and organizations where healthcare services are provided.:Personal names, given or surname, as cultural characteristics, as ethnological or religious patterns, as indications of the geographic distribution of families and inbreeding, etc. Analysis of isonymy, the quality of having the same or similar names, is useful in the study of population genetics. NAMES is used also for the history of names or name changes of corporate bodies, such as medical societies, universities, hospitals, government agencies, etc.

Concepts.definition: The buildings and organizations where healthcare services are provided.

A word or group of words indicating the identity of a person usually consisting of a first (personal) name and a last (family) name with an optional middle name. In some cultural traditions the family name comes first.
